title: Swinging Arm - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Remove the frame adjuster sleeve from the frame insert.
Clean the threads of the adjuster and frame insert.
Apply anti-seize compound to the threads of the frame adjuster sleeve and frame insert.
Refit the frame adjuster sleeve fully into the frame insert.
Protect the drive chain from contamination during installation of the swinging arm.
Make sure brake lines, harnesses and hoses are not damaged during installation of the swinging arm.
Make sure that the brake pipes or hoses do not become bent or kinked during assembly.
Bent or kinked brake pipes can cause a reduction in braking efficiency.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Position the swinging arm to the frame making sure the drive chain is in position on the rubbing strip.
Refit the swinging arm spindle from the right hand side making sure it will support the swinging arm, but not pass all the way through the frame adjuster sleeve.
in the slots in the frame adjuster sleeve.
, tighten the frame adjuster sleeve until it comes into contact with the swinging arm bush.
Release the frame adjuster sleeve and then tighten to
Fully insert the swinging arm spindle.
Fit the washer and a new swinging arm spindle lock nut and tighten to
Fit the finishers to the swinging arm spindle.
Refit the rear brake line into the clip on the swinging arm.

body.name: Rear Brake line clip onto swinging arm_TD1_markup

body.body: Position the lower rear suspension unit to the swinging arm.
Fit the spacer into the swinging arm.
Insert the rear suspension unit lower mounting bolt trough the spacer and rear suspension unit
Fit and tighten the lock nut to
The rear suspension unit should be tightened after the rear wheel has been installed, with the weight of the motorcycle on its wheels.
Pump the rear brake pedal several times to position the brake pads in the caliper. Rectify as necessary.
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
Failure to take remedial action may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
